author: beegeedee
title: Lovely little poly(bag)
review:
Lego freebies are usually great, some better than others and I think this falls into the better part. It's a quaint little set with a nice little Olaf see below for more

Box/Instructions

No box but a fairly sizeable bag with fold-out instructions. Nothing much to be said here but they do the job nicely.

Parts

There's a great selection of parts here. you have the 2 palm leafs which never go amiss, the 2x2 tiles in bright pink and medium azure are nice. The clear goblet and the 4x4 rounded plates with holes are all great. The crab is a nice addition too. There's also 6 spares which are of the usual variety - rounded plates, the lever and base and spares for Olaf, which knowing my daughter she will lose them most promptly.

Minifigures

A single minifigure - Olaf. He's a brick-built figure with a custom moulded head  which captures his face perfectly. Overall a great figure.

The build

I'll probably dismantle the whole thing so my daughter can make it but it's fairly simple and nicely put together. 2 minutes to put together, probably 10 minutes for a little kid.

The completed model

According to the information, there's 41 pieces which I believe excludes the individual parts of Olaf. For this amount it's a lovely model which you can't really fault (ok, you could but why....) There's not a huge amount of play in the set but saying that, I can see my daughter singing the song while playing so the play factor is for kids.

Overall opinion

For kids, especially those who are fans of the movie, this will go down a storm. For me, I got it for free and I was ordering anyway, it has nice parts and it's a nice little set as well.

 

Thanks LEGO for a lovely little set.

author: Odeinoichus
title: In Summer!
review:
Set #30397 Olaf’s Summertime Fun: If you want a cheap way to get an Olaf character than this is the set for you, it’s going to be made available free at LEGO S&H during August, it was also available at Toy’s-R-Us earlier this year and some can still be found. Is it a good polybag set? Well read on to find out.

Pros:

  • Captures a scene from the film in a great fun manner with tons of buildable elements.

  • Models include a place to lounge on a beach with an umbrella, radio and cool beverages to drink. A tree for shade next to a portion of river or ocean, which includes a LEGO Crab and a buildable reindeer flotation device for Olaf.

  • Olaf is a fun buildable character.

  • Includes a clear donut piece.

Cons:

  • Olaf slides around a lot when in his flotation device, and doesn’t sit very well on the slightly too short lounging towel.

  • Olaf can’t hold accessories either, including them is a bit of a waste.

Overall opinion

This set is pretty fun. It looks good and the models are a solid build, even Olaf can be fun to play with, if you haven’t gotten any of the other Frozen sets it’s also a very cheap method for getting him. There is sadly not too much to do with him though, he can lounge on the beach listening to the radio or float around in his little floaty. I would suggest this makes a better companion piece for other sets, still it is worth tracking down and I definitely recommend it for Frozen fans.

author: StevenTheBrick
title: Olaf's Summertime Fun
review:
3/5

 

Good parts for a small set, however the Olaf figure is now very outdated. The building experience was ok. The price is great for what's included. The playability is meh.

author: Lobo_da_boss_
title: Obscure and cool
review:
Opening;

Olafs summer time fun a great polybag for play , the amount of stuff and the price .

The Minifigures-

The figure has a very nice moulded head with an orange unicorn horn for a carrot nose , his body is built around a 1×1 white snot brick with Townsend and a lump of coal connected and the feet is just one 2×2 white dome .

The builds-

The small inflatable boat is not bad and fits olaf in easily and has the suggestion of an animal head on the front . The bed and umbrella are also nice residing in a 4×4 light tan plate , the bed is tiled off nicely and the umbrella is a two piece build also there is a glass along with a bottle off some sort and a radio with an antenna . The final build is the biggest as it is on a 6×8 plate there is a suggestion of sand at the bottom of the tree which is a dry nice build the waves are very well recreated with three 2×2 tiles and three 1×1 trans light blue studs .

In conclusion-

this is one of my favourite polybags as I feel as if it has something for everyone and so much stuff in general .
